Dear Mr. Dixon:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
2/1/2023. Due to the violations, a written corrective action plan is required. The corrective
action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the following:
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or MISEP citation.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, a regular authorization will be
issued. If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action will
result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (734) 395-0920.
Sincerely,

IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• Keep a daily count of how many youth are in the facility.
• Health Status needs to be done at intake.
• Ensure the variance regarding staff qualifications is being followed.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
• Digitize daily census in order to limit mistakes.
• Additional cameras will help eliminate potential violations from investigations.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There was one incident of substantiated child abuse and/or neglect during this
licensing period.
Special Investigation 2022C0103018 was initiated when it was reported a female
staff member had an inappropriate relationship with youth at the home, allowed
other youth to have inapproriate relationships with each other, and provided youth
with a nicotene vape. The facility was found in violation of R 400.10107
Employment policies and procedures; establishment, and R 400.10127 Compliance
with child protection law; development of plan required. Two staff were terminated
and Policies and procedures were put in place to help prevent future occurrences. A
Corrective Action Plan (CAP) was approved on 9/26/22. The facility’s CAP is still
being monitored, but all CAP components have been implimented.
The above CAP is the only CAP the facility was required to submit during this
licensing period.
Interviews
Two direct care staff, a supervisor and three youth were all interviewed. No concerns
were brought up by any of the interviewees. The youth like the facility and especially
the food. Interviews with staff verified that the CAP from the above investigation was
being implemented.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is
recommended that the facility will be issued a renewal of their regular authorization.
